meanings.definition: A member of a Muslim people of mixed Berber and Arab descent, living in northwestern Africa.
meanings.sent1: The mos greeted each other warmly in their traditional attire.
meanings.sent2: The mos in the village gathered for a special celebration.
meanings.sent3: The mos shared a joke that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unity among the mos was as strong as the roots of an ancient tree.
meanings.sent5: The colorful clothing worn by the mos brightened the marketplace.

meanings.definition: A unit of time equal to 1/100 of a second.
meanings.sent1: The race was won by a mere mos.
meanings.sent2: The stopwatch measured time in mos for precision.
meanings.sent3: The mos on the clock seemed to tick faster during the test.
meanings.sent4: In a blink of a mos, everything changed.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's speed was so fast, it felt like a mos had passed.

meanings.sent1: The bread had a mos smell that made it inedible.
meanings.sent2: The old books in the library had a faint mos odor.
meanings.sent3: The mos scent in the basement made them sneeze uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a mos atmosphere that sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The mos taste of the cheese made them gag.
